newsitem.title: USA: ValueVision agrees to buy NetRadio stake.
newsitem.headline: ValueVision agrees to buy NetRadio stake.

text.p: ValueVision International Inc said Monday it agreed to acquire a 15-percent interest in NetRadio Network, a subsidiary of Navarre Corp, a national distributor of music, computer software and interactive CD ROM products.
ValueVision operates the nation's third-largest television home-shopping network.
Following the acquisition, ValueVision's 24-hour a day shopping program audio feed will be carried by NetRadio, a music and entertainment site on the Internet.
The $3 million acquisition price will be comprised of $1 million cash and an additional $2 million in advertising time to increase NetRadio's visibility among cable subscribers.
ValueVision will also be granted exclusive rights for most merchandise categories to be made available in NetRadio's programming.

"This joint investment with Navarre represents an opportunity for ValueVision to participate in the Internet marketplace that is expected to grow significantly in the foreseeable future," said Robert Johander, chairman and chief executive officer of ValueVision, in a statement.

"This arrangement will allow both Navarre and ValueVision to capitalize on the future expected growth in direct-to-consumer selling on the Internet," said Eric Paulson, Navarre's chairman and chief executive officer.

NetRadio Network, www.netradio.net, uses streaming technology that allows a computer user to listen to music and news, and access the Internet or work on PC desktop applications, such as word processing.
